body: this happens way to often to be ignore my own team mate purposly banned my pick intent AGAIN because he wanted to fuckin go thresh jg why is this even allowed? why is it not addressed? this is so toxic plus i cant even report them because thats not an option please lets not the the troll players prevail

replies.body: And I said it already and I'll say it again: as frustrating as it is to get a troll banning the champ you hovered on purpose, there are still plenty of legitimate reasons to ban a champ hovered by a team-mate (contested pick and you're not first pick, for instance). So no, we can't do that.

Dude, chillax.  Seriously.  Just cause they banned your champ doesn't mean you can't go with someone else.  My personal favorite is that if they ban your champ, go for an off-meta champ for that role, and carry hard.  Of course, this would require that you become skilled with some harder champs, but the chat convo's you can have with the trollilng guy are just amazing.  And there's always the option of "if you hadn't banned my main, I would be doing fine" if you get killed a little bit.

All these people telling you to just pick a different champion.

No. How about everyone stops being dicks to each other just to be dicks? 
I've seen way, WAY too many people say "I don't like that champion, so you're not playing it' and they ban it. 

This is DIFFERENT from a previous mentioned situation (and similar situations):
> (contested pick and you're not first pick, for instance)

First off, you're playing normals, what do you expect? 

Secondly, learn to play other champions! You're really only playing 2 champions consistently and you have a 25% win rate in normals!!! I think it's time to widen your champion pool and pick up something maybe less challenging.  Focus on less mechanically challenged/beginner friendly champions instead. If you like Mid and jungle try picking Morgana, Ahri, Lux for mid and Graves, Amumu, and  Hecarim. 

You should be able to play at least 3 champions per role you want to main, so 3 for primary and 3 for secondary. That way if someone bans your first pick you have 2 more to fall back on and you won't get so tilted or upset about it.
